result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul J. DuPlayee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8:34 a.m. Defendant Paul J. DuPlayee in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Defendant Paul J. DuPlayee in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan statement to modification of sentence to 25 days jail. Court grants good time if revoked 25 days credit not original 30 days. Adj. 8:37 a.m.

Defendant Paul J. DuPlayee in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:36
State moves to amend count 1 to 948.09 - (mis)  Granted - Has complied with Victim rights- no response from victim/family - Plea questionnaire filed- NO contest plea to amended charge -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Schiek/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing - 
Court WHS and POP for 1 year
$100 fine -  -(From bond posted)/Supervision fees- Submit DNA sample- 30 days jail - huber for all purposes - commence on/before 9-17 @ 8am  - 3 days credit if revoked - any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO  - 
Appeal rights given 
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

10:41 a.m. - Defendant Paul J. DuPlayee in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shieck states just rec'd supplemental report yesterday - provided to defense for review.  Schiek states victim notified of today's hearing, although the letter dated June 29th indicated today was set for a preliminary hearing vs a sentencing hearing.  Court will not proceed with sentencing today due to lack of response from victim and the issue concerning the victim did not know today would proceed to sentencing.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 10:50 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

01:19 pm - Defendant Paul J. DuPlayee in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued - Defendant provides new phone number.  Adjourned.  01:20 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
and $6500 signature bond - No contact with M.M.K., no contact with any females under the age of 18.

01:41 pm - Defendant Paul J. DuPlayee in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant unsure as to obtaining counsel.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash  bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:15 pm.  Adjourned 01:47 p.m.
